title: Why are mods removing posts related to Hong Kong
body: The mods claim its not related to the game but it is. The mods say they make some exceptions. Disliking rito supporting hong kong is apparently somehow not an exception. The mods say this causes debates. What debates? Its like trying to claim Hitler is a god. Its not a debate, its someone making a fool of themselves. I didn't know mods were paid by China too.

replies.body: Discussions relating to Hong Kong inherently violate our rules against political and social discussions. Similarly, we donâ€™t allow discussions about an individual mentioned in this post, and if you continue to violate our rules, we will suspend your account, full stop.
Politics are not allowed on the boards. It's very clear. Hong Kong is clearly  about politics and has nothing to do with LoL. It has no place on this board.

As I said the rules state exceptions can be made
Hong Kong is political but does relate to the game, as I said Hong Kong Attitude a LoL e sports team is clearly getting unfairly treated, most specifically by casters.

Making a post about HKA  will be fine. Talk about how they are doing as an esport team or how bad a flash was and you will keep your post. 

Talk about HKA being oppressed by Tencent or China, or something related to Hong Kongs current issues and it will be removed. I'm sure you are able to decipher between the 2. 

This useless banter is not meant for the boards, there is no need for an exception.

To prove how useless HK is to League. If it was to disappear tomorrow. League would be 99.9% unaffected. The game would continue the player base in Asia would drop slightly and League would proceed as normal. So no, HK does not relate to the game. 

Also there is plenty of instances of HK being used in cast and on the Divephoria.

Politics are forbidden unless they directly relate to the game. The most recent case would be Net Neutrality, which was inarguably related to League and its ability to continue to function. I fail to see how Hong Kong is on that degree at *all*.
